A #surfacetransportation reauthorization this Congress is critical for #rail passengers in #IL03 & across our nation. I lay out my priorities as Chair of the House Railroads, Pipelines & Hazmat Subcommittee in this @rail_pro_mag op-ed #transportation http://bit.ly/2D42R4R

#100x50 legislation will ensure that our planet is protected. I am proud to support the 100% Clean Economy Act of 2019, which not only addresses the climate crisis, but also strengthens our economy and public health.

2/2 BLS data shows that workplace violence in healthcare & social services sectors has increased by 80 percent over the last 10 years. We must take action to reverse this disturbing trend. @AFSCME, @NationalNurses, @nasw, @enaorg & other groups stand in strong support of #HR1309

Proud to be a co-sponsor of the workplace violence prevention legislation that passed the House today. #HR1309 compels @OSHA_DOL to issue a standard requiring employers within the health care & social service sectors to implement comprehensive #ViolencePrevention programs. 1/2

Only 9% of Americans with #pancreaticcancer survive 5+ years & it’s the 3rd leading cause of cancer-related deaths in the US. I’m raising awareness on #WPCD to bring attention to the world’s deadliest major cancer and prioritize lifesaving research. #PANCaware

Proud to join my colleagues in support of bipartisan bill to strengthen U.S. Export-Import Bank & create American jobs. EXIM supports small businesses by promoting export of U.S. goods. From 2014-2020 the total value of exports from #EXIM-backed businesses in #IL03 exceeded $41M!

@HouseScience today subpoenaed @EPAAwheeler to explain why @EPA continues to drag its feet as we oversee the critical program that evaluates risk of #chemicals to human health. It’s important we know why EPA stopped its review of the risk formaldehyde may pose.

Today @HouseScience took bipartisan action to ensure security and integrity of our elections.  Voters must have confidence that when they cast their ballots it will not be lost or tampered w/ but will be accurately counted.

Canada, UK, Germany, France, & Japan. #Drugmakers who refuse to negotiate in good faith w/ #Medicare would face stiff penalties. Passing this bill could save patients’ lives & save hundreds of millions of dollars. 4/4

w/ manufacturers, #Rx drug plan sponsors, & #MedicareAdvantage organizations to collaboratively work together to lower the cost of these drugs for patients. Excessive pricing is defined as exceeding 110% of the avg prices for such drugs in 5 reference countries: ¾

My bill lifts the current legal ban on #Medicare negotiating w/ drug companies for lower prices & sets up a process for @HHSGov to review the cost of life-sustaining prescription drugs for excessive pricing. When a drug price is determined to be excessive, HHS will negotiate 2/4

Today I introduced legislation to fight back against #BigPharma's price-gouging on life-sustaining #RxDrugs. As someone who’s been an insulin-dependent diabetic for 30 years, I’m intimately familiar w/ how much the price of this life-sustaining drug has skyrocketed. ¼ pic.twitter.com/fmTPcwd6Hd

Nov 9, 1989. The gates were opened and the #BerlinWall began to fall. 5 days later I was there to witness history. I’ll never forget seeing Germans from the East walking to freedom, freedom that had been denied by the “Evil Empire” of the Soviet Union. #berlinwall30 pic.twitter.com/b90YKkR764
